contracts.title: Lytham Crematorium Development
contracts.description: Fylde Borough Council's aim is to continue interning body's within the existing site and so require the perched water that accumulates throughout wet periods to be removed sustainably. The requirement is to remove the water by a series of parallel field drains that discharge to a detention basin, this detention basin is anticipated to be flooded in the wet months and reduce in size throughout the dryer months. It is not the intention of the Council to create a pond thus restricting the

contracts.title: Fairhaven Lake & Gardens Restoration - National Lottery Heritage Fund Project Main Works
contracts.description:
Fylde Council is a progressive Local Authority located on the Lancashire coast and is a major tourism destination attracting around 3 million visitors per annum, which places the role of the borough's green spaces high on our agenda. The authority has a proven track record of delivering high standards of parks management and grounds maintenance which results in numerous annual quality awards. The borough contains 6 Green Flag award winning parks.

Fylde Town Hall is the main offices for both Council employees and Council elected members.
